main event: On 22 April 1949, in Cliff, New Mexico, a civilian observed an aluminum-colored, round, flat, thin-disc-shaped object heading east, which was in view for about two minutes before disappearing behind some mountains.
interesting points: The observer saw a single unidentified aerial object for about two minutes while driving into town.
The object was described as an aluminum-colored, round, flat, thin-disc-shaped object with an apparent size of over 15 feet in diameter.
It was observed at an altitude of 20 degrees, dropping slowly, and was estimated to be over twenty two miles away from the observer.
The object appeared to move on a diamagnetic axis as it dropped behind the Mogollon Mountains, showing flat and thin edges.
No sound, odor, or effects on clouds were reported during the observation.
